vulnerability_findings.name: arbitrary-send
vulnerability_findings.message:
Marriage.sendMessage (patch_3.sol#104-114) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- owner.transfer(this.balance) (patch_3.sol#110)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function changeOwner(address _newOwner) public onlyOwner {
        newOwner = _newOwner;
vulnerability_findings.message: Owned.changeOwner (patch_3.sol#17-19) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.message: Owned.acceptOwnership (patch_3.sol#21-25) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.message: Owned.execute (patch_3.sol#27-29) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: pragma solidity ^0.4.16;
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in patch_3.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.16 (patch_3.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function execute(address _dst, uint _value, bytes _data) public onlyOwner {
        require(_dst.call.value(_value)(_data));
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Owned.execute (patch_3.sol#27-29):
	-require(bool)(_dst.call.value(_value)(_data)) patch_3.sol#28
